intro: Bauhinia ayabacensis, commonly known as the Ayabacé bauhinia, is a small deciduous tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive bipinnate leaves and showy, papilionaceous flowers. The plant produces small, flat pods that contain several seeds, and it is adapted to thrive in humid, tropical environments. Its growth habit and botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitat.
